id: DPDPA Rules/Exemptions for Processing Children’s Data
title: Rule 11: Exemptions for Processing Children’s Data
description: While Rule 10 requires parental or guardian consent before processing a child’s personal data, Rule 11 introduces certain exemptions. These exemptions exist because not every instance of handling a child’s data poses a risk, and the law recognizes the need for practical flexibility.
source: @site/docs/2. DPDPA Rules/11- Exemptions for Processing Children’s Data.md
